column4: I'm going for my first install of Ubuntu 8.04.  I've checked my hardware, figured out how to get speech during install (I'm a blind computer user), and am generally ready to try it.  I've got an Intel t7100 or so (64-bit whatever the number)  I realize that Linux supports up to 64 gb of ram, even with 32-bit processors.  Is there any real advantage in using the 64-bit Ubuntu Desktop installation?  How about disadvantages?
Imo there are more disadvantages than advantages
performance increase is minimal and you might find yourself in need of 32 bit software later on
only the server kernel has PAE pre-compiled
